channel.itunes:summary: Bill Caskey and Bryan Neale: B2B sales trainers for the past twenty years share their strategies, frameworks, tips and tricks to help you leverage your talent, grow your skills and create your own sales success. You'll discover how you can shift your mindset, win with prospects and build long-term relationships with your clients so you can thrive and advance in your career. Bill and Bryan's approach to sales is funny, often quirky and always real. Their work has allowed them to help sales professionals, managers and leaders at hundreds of companies all over the world implement successful strategies and build profitable sales teams. Prospecting, sales communication, buyer resistance, proposals and RFPs, pricing, cold calling, sales forecasting, pain points, psychology, positioning, deal coaching, goal setting, leading and managing, achieving your goals and all the other things that work (and don't work) in the world of sales to help you be the best possible version of yourself.

item.title: #806: The Price is Right - Overcoming Resistance
item.itunes:title: #806: The Price is Right - Overcoming Resistance
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan tackle the timely issue of price resistance in sales. As inflation rises and budgets tighten, salespeople are facing increased pushback on pricing.

Bill and Bryan share valuable insights on how to handle these objections effectively. They discuss recognizing when "price" is masking a deeper issue of perceived value, and the importance of reframing the conversation from "price" to "economics."

The guys also provide tips for focusing on the full economic picture and ROI. Whether you're dealing with budget constraints, increased cost sensitivity, or prospects looking to negotiate, this episode provides practical advice for sales professionals navigating today's challenging economic landscape.

=================================

Is it time to make a BOLD move in your business? If so, download our brand new book, "12 Bold Moves - Insider Secrete to Reinventing Yourself and Your Business." http://12boldmoves.com

The Insider program is open for enrollment. If you have not checked out our small learning group, go to http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/insider to join today!

If you haven't already, make sure you join us in our LinkedIn group: http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/linkedin.

=================================

item.title: Cold Calling Sucks: An Eye-Opening Convo with 30 Minutes to President's Club
item.itunes:title: Cold Calling Sucks: An Eye-Opening Convo with 30 Minutes to President's Club
item.description:
In this solo episode, Bryan engages in a dynamic conversation with Armand Farrokh and Nick Cegelski, co-hosts of the 30 Minutes to President's Club podcast. 

The duo shares insights from their new book, "Cold Calling Sucks, and That's Why It Works," which challenges common misconceptions about cold calling and provides data-backed strategies for success. 

Discover surprising statistics on voice mails, objections, and the power of multithreading in sales and unlock a wealth of other practical advice to revolutionize your cold calling game!

If you're ready to learn more about the Blind Zebra Sales Operating System, you can get the details here.

item.title: #805: Sales Lessons From Prince and Peyton Manning
item.itunes:title: #805: Sales Lessons From Prince and Peyton Manning
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan draw unexpected parallels between sales excellence and two legendary figures: musical icon Prince and NFL quarterback Peyton Manning. They explore how the dedication, work ethic, and interpersonal skills of these superstars can inspire sales professionals to elevate their game.

The guys discuss the importance of a relentless commitment to mastery, consistent practice, and staying grounded while connecting with your team and customers. They also delve into the value of personal development, continuous improvement, and the crucial role of passion in achieving long-term success.

=================================

Is it time to make a BOLD move in your business? If so, download our brand new book, "12 Bold Moves - Insider Secrete to Reinventing Yourself and Your Business." http://12boldmoves.com

The Insider program is open for enrollment. If you have not checked out our small learning group, go to http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/insider to join today!

If you haven't already, make sure you join us in our LinkedIn group: http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/linkedin.

=================================

item.title: #804: Breaking Free From Business Blinders
item.itunes:title: #804: Breaking Free From Business Blinders
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan delve into the critical issue of recognizing and addressing blind spots in business and sales. They explore how business owners can become too entrenched in their thinking, missing obvious solutions to their problems.

The guys discuss the impact of stress on decision-making and offer techniques for identifying personal stress indicators. They emphasize the importance of challenging assumptions and listening to instincts, providing valuable strategies for improving self-awareness and decision-making in high-pressure business environments.

Bill and Bryan offer practical advice for salespeople and business leaders on how to pull focus, overcome fixed mindsets, and remain open to new perspectives.

=================================

Is it time to make a BOLD move in your business? If so, download our brand new book, "12 Bold Moves - Insider Secrete to Reinventing Yourself and Your Business." http://12boldmoves.com

The Insider program is open for enrollment. If you have not checked out our small learning group, go to http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/insider to join today!

If you haven't already, make sure you join us in our LinkedIn group: http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/linkedin.

=================================

item.title: #803: Why Sales Training Doesn't Work
item.itunes:title: #803: Why Sales Training Doesn't Work
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan challenge conventional wisdom by arguing that traditional sales training is no longer effective in today's business landscape.

Drawing from their decades of experience, they discuss why common sales methodologies fall short and why focusing solely on "getting to yes" is a flawed approach. The guys explore why companies default to sales training when results are lacking, the limitations of one-size-fits-all training programs, and how younger generations like Millennials and Gen Z are changing the sales game.

They emphasize the need for a more holistic, authentic approach to sales achievement and explain why running your sales territory "like a business" is crucial but rarely taught. And offer fresh perspectives on what truly drives sales success in the modern era, suggesting it's time for a paradigm shift in how we approach sales development and training. 

=================================

Is it time to make a BOLD move in your business? If so, download our brand new book, "12 Bold Moves - Insider Secrete to Reinventing Yourself and Your Business." http://12boldmoves.com

The Insider program is open for enrollment. If you have not checked out our small learning group, go to http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/insider to join today!

If you haven't already, make sure you join us in our LinkedIn group: http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/linkedin.

=================================

item.title: Live from Indianapolis
item.itunes:title: Live from Indianapolis
item.description:
In this solo episode, Bryan is at the Blind Zebra World Headquarters in Indianapolis, in front of a live audience. As we reach the midpoint of 2024, the first half has been challenging for some of us and outstanding for others, but everyone is eager to finish the year strong.

Bryan is joined by John Geter, Regional Sales Manager at Partners Personnel, to discuss the outlook for the back half of '24. They explore John’s plans for the next six months and emphasize the importance of shifting from annual planning to a six-month business strategy. This approach allows for a much-needed reset, considering all the changes experienced in the first half of the year.

If you're ready to learn more about the Blind Zebra Sales Operating System, you can get the details here.

item.title: #802: The Choices That Shape Your Success
item.itunes:title: #802: The Choices That Shape Your Success
item.description:
In this episode, Bill Caskey and Bryan Neale explore critical career dilemmas faced by sales professionals.

They discuss pivotal choices such as staying in a comfortable job versus seeking new opportunities, breaking through income plateaus, and embracing personal branding. They emphasize how recognizing these moments and making intentional decisions can significantly impact career growth.

The guys offer advice on approaching these challenges, highlighting that even small choices can lead to substantial long-term success. 

=================================

Is it time to make a BOLD move in your business? If so, download our brand new book, "12 Bold Moves - Insider Secrete to Reinventing Yourself and Your Business." http://12boldmoves.com

item.title: Live from Kansas City
item.itunes:title: Live from Kansas City
item.description:
In this solo episode, Bryan comes to you from Lonnie’s Reno Club at the Ambassador Hotel in Kansas City. Bryan and a live audience are joined by a longtime listener, Chad Waldo.

Bryan and Chad reflect on their early careers in sales, from pressure to panic, and tell some personal stories that will likely resonate with anyone who’s ever been new to sales. They also discuss the math of sales, the importance of patience, and remind us to focus on controllable behaviors.

Want to learn more about the Blind Zebra Sales Operating System? Let's go!

item.title: #801: Diagnosing Your Way to More Deals
item.itunes:title: #801: Diagnosing Your Way to More Deals
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan dive into the critical skill of sales diagnostics. Drawing insights from Bill's recent health experience, they explore how thorough "lab work" in sales can uncover compelling reasons for prospects to change.

The guys discuss the importance of intention, assertiveness, and detachment in the sales process, emphasizing the need for salespeople to become skilled diagnosticians rather than order-takers.

They also offer practical tips on improving your diagnostic game, including how to use data effectively and when to walk away from opportunities. 

=================================

Is it time to make a BOLD move in your business? If so, download our brand new book, "12 Bold Moves - Insider Secrete to Reinventing Yourself and Your Business." http://12boldmoves.com

item.title: #800: The Wake-up Call: Taking Stock of Your Habits and Behaviors
item.itunes:title: #800: The Wake-up Call: Taking Stock of Your Habits and Behaviors
item.description:
In this episode, Bill shares his personal story of a recent health scare that served as a wake-up call, prompting him to reevaluate his habits and behaviors.

The guys delve into the importance of self-awareness, taking inventory of our actions, and the outcomes they produce. They discuss how easily we can fall into complacency, letting unproductive habits and outdated thinking hold us back from achieving our full potential.

This episode challenges listeners to take a hard look at their own habits, behaviors, and thought patterns, and consider what changes might be necessary to break through plateaus and reach new levels of success. 

=================================

Is it time to make a BOLD move in your business? If so, download our brand new book, "12 Bold Moves - Insider Secrete to Reinventing Yourself and Your Business." http://12boldmoves.com

item.title: #799: Future-Proofing Yourself Through Personal Branding
item.itunes:title: #799: Future-Proofing Yourself Through Personal Branding
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss the importance of actively building and maintaining your personal brand, even when you aren't actively looking for a new job. They emphasize how potential employers almost always review candidates' online presence, especially on LinkedIn, even before looking at resumes.

They guys share strategies for optimizing your LinkedIn profile, creating content that showcases your expertise, and nurturing your network consistently. They also propose the powerful idea of building your own email list of friends, family, acquaintances and past clients to share valuable content and insights with - making you top of mind when opportunities arise. 

=================================

Is it time to make a BOLD move in your business? If so, download our brand new book, "12 Bold Moves - Insider Secrete to Reinventing Yourself and Your Business." http://12boldmoves.com

item.title: #798: Overcoming Resistance to Change
item.itunes:title: #798: Overcoming Resistance to Change
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan Neale delve into the common resistance people face when trying to implement new approaches or strategies, particularly in the sales world.

The guys discuss the underlying reasons for this reluctance, often rooted in fear, and how to overcome it. Drawing from personal experiences and insights, they provide practical tips on recognizing self-limiting beliefs, embracing a growth mindset, and taking calculated risks to break through stagnation.

Whether you're a seasoned professional or just starting out, this episode offers valuable perspectives on embracing change and continuous improvement for long-term success.

=================================

Is it time to make a BOLD move in your business? If so, download our brand new book, "12 Bold Moves - Insider Secrete to Reinventing Yourself and Your Business." http://12boldmoves.com

item.title: #797: The Lost Art of Questioning in Sales
item.itunes:title: #797: The Lost Art of Questioning in Sales
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss what they see as the lost art of asking effective, insightful questions during sales discovery and qualification.

Many salespeople rush through this stage by asking leading questions rather than using open-ended queries to genuinely understand the prospect's situation. 

The guys argue that failing to properly qualify through skillful questioning leads to cluttered pipelines full of unqualified deals. And they emphasize relearning the art of questioning to have more honest, productive sales conversations that expose the right opportunities.

=================================

Is it time to make a BOLD move in your business? If so, download our brand new book, "12 Bold Moves - Insider Secrete to Reinventing Yourself and Your Business." http://12boldmoves.com

item.content:encoded:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss what they see as the lost art of asking effective, insightful questions during sales discovery and qualification.

Many salespeople rush through this stage by asking leading questions rather than using open-ended queries to genuinely understand the prospect's situation. 

The guys argue that failing to properly qualify through skillful questioning leads to cluttered pipelines full of unqualified deals. And they emphasize relearning the art of questioning to have more honest, productive sales conversations that expose the right opportunities.

=================================

item.title: Reframing the Money Conversation
item.itunes:title: Reframing the Money Conversation
item.description:
In this solo episode, Bill shares a powerful strategy for having more effective and comfortable conversations about pricing, ROI, and the financial implications of your product or service.

He explains why salespeople often struggle with money conversations and avoid bringing up pricing until the last minute. His key advice is to reframe the pricing discussion to look at the full "economic picture" surrounding the prospect's investment decision.

By expanding the dialogue to encompass all of these financial elements, you can have a deeper, more thoughtful discussion that the prospect will appreciate.

Is it time to make a BOLD move in your business? If so, download our brand new book, "12 Bold Moves - Insider Secrete to Reinventing Yourself and Your Business." http://12boldmoves.com

item.itunes:title: #796: Uncovering Your Blind Spots
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan delve into the importance of self-reflection for salespeople. They share thought-provoking questions that every salesperson should ask themselves to identify their true purpose, uncover limiting beliefs, and unlock their full potential.

From understanding your "why" to recognizing your unique abilities and desired future, this episode provides a roadmap for self-examination and personal growth. Gain valuable insights to help you break through ceilings, align your career with your deeper motivations, and achieve greater success in sales and in life.

Don't miss this inspiring conversation that will challenge you to look inward and strive for continuous improvement.

item.title: Proclaim Your Sales Process, But Don't Control It
item.itunes:title: Proclaim Your Sales Process, But Don't Control It
item.description:
In this solo episode, Bill Caskey shares a counterintuitive approach to controlling the sales process more effectively.

He emphasizes the importance of having a clearly defined sales process to guide prospects throughout, but advocates against trying to forcefully control or push prospects through the process.

He provides practical insights on when to disengage from unresponsive prospects and focuses on attracting customers who value and respect the sales process. 

Ready to Challenge the limits of your income? Join the Million Dollar Seller 5-Day Challenge Today! http://milliondollarsellerchallenge.com

item.title: #795: Breaking Through the Fear of Change
item.itunes:title: #795: Breaking Through the Fear of Change
item.description:
In this insightful episode, Bill and Bryan dive deep into the challenges salespeople and businesses face when trying to implement new strategies and make meaningful changes. They emphasize the importance of examining one's mindset and recognizing the underlying fears that often hinder progress.

They discuss how defensive mechanisms and attachments to old ways of thinking can prevent individuals from embracing new behaviors and ideas, even when those changes could lead to better results.

The guys encourage listeners to question their own resistance to change and explore what they might be afraid of, whether it's fear of failure, fear of success, or fear of judgment.

=================================

item.title: The Pre-Game Mental Routine for Sales Success
item.itunes:title: The Pre-Game Mental Routine for Sales Success
item.description:
In this solo episode, Bill Caskey dives into the critical mental and physical preparation needed before any important sales call, presentation, or client interaction.

He emphasizes the importance of getting your mind in the right state by focusing on the proper intention - which is never to "sell them something." 

Bill provides practical tips on clarifying your intention to serve the client's needs and having a clear plan for executing the first 30-60 seconds to start interactions powerfully. He stresses that nailing the opening sets the tone for the entire engagement. 

Ready to Challenge the limits of your income? Join the Million Dollar Seller 5-Day Challenge Today! http://milliondollarsellerchallenge.com

item.title: #794: Escaping the Sales Funk
item.itunes:title: #794: Escaping the Sales Funk
item.description:
In this episode, Bryan and Bill address the general "funk" or malaise they're sensing across the sales landscape as the first quarter of the year comes to a close.

With many companies missing their goals, leadership teams applying undue pressure, and salespeople making excuses, the guys offer advice for overcoming this negative mindset. They emphasize taking individual responsibility, adopting new prospecting behaviors and strategies, and avoiding the trap of "old thinking" that leads to stagnation.

Whether feeling stuck in a funk or open to change, listeners will get a motivating kick to break out of unproductive routines and position themselves for success in any market conditions. 

=================================

item.itunes:title: How to Get Past Fear and Anxiety
item.description:
In this solo episode, Bill Caskey addresses a common challenge faced by professionals: the nagging feeling of fear, anxiety, or doubt that can creep up unexpectedly. Drawing from his extensive experience, Bill shares a simple yet powerful strategy to overcome these mental hurdles.

By adopting a mindset centered on genuinely helping the customer, regardless of whether they ultimately choose to work with you, the fear and anxiety dissipate.

item.title: #793: The Freedom of Detachment
item.itunes:title: #793: The Freedom of Detachment
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan explore the concept of detachment from outcomes, inspired by insights from renowned thinker Seth Godin.

The guys discuss the importance of embracing the journey itself rather than being overly attached to specific results. Using examples from their own experiences, they delve into how letting go of outcome fixation can open up new pathways for growth, creativity, and fulfillment.

This thought-provoking episode encourages listeners to find joy in the process and not get caught up in chasing externally defined markers of success. It's a refreshing reminder to stay present and enjoy the ride, wherever it may lead.

=================================

item.title: #792: Embracing Objections in the Sales Process
item.itunes:title: #792: Embracing Objections in the Sales Process
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan explore how salespeople's natural optimism and positive outlook can sometimes hinder their ability to effectively handle objections and resistance from prospects.

Drawing parallels to the highly anticipated solar eclipse, they discuss the importance of shifting into an "emotionally neutral" mindset to approach objections as opportunities for collaboration and learning, rather than obstacles to overcome.

The guys delve into the concept of "yellow flags" - proactively identifying potential roadblocks with clients - and the benefits of this transparent approach. Tune in to discover how embracing the "eclipse" of objections can ultimately lead to stronger relationships and more successful sales outcomes.

=================================

item.title: #791: Seek Clarity, Find Confidence
item.itunes:title: #791: Seek Clarity, Find Confidence
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss one of the bold moves from Bill's new book "12 Bold Moves" - the idea that clarity yields confidence.

The guys explore how getting clear on intentions, roles, structures, and agendas can boost confidence in various situations, whether it's giving a presentation, handling a difficult client call, or creating video content. They share personal examples and insights on how seeking clarity, rather than just trying to muster up confidence, can position you for success. 

Whether you're in sales, performing on stage, or pursuing any endeavor, this episode highlights the transformative power of clarity in building true confidence.

item.title: #790: Game the Plan: Compensation Strategies with Xactly's Taylor Wilding
item.itunes:title: #790: Game the Plan: Compensation Strategies with Xactly's Taylor Wilding
item.description:
Bill and Bryan are joined by Taylor Wilding, VP of Sales at Xactly, to discuss key principles around effective sales compensation plan design.

Taylor shares insights on motivating the right behaviors, balancing corporate goals with individual incentives, the importance of pipeline accuracy, and how reps can take an intentional approach to achieving their own income goals.

They also cover warning signs that your compensation plan may need an overhaul and provide details on Xactly's upcoming Upside user conference in San Francisco.

Struggling to design a sales compensation plan that actually works? Check out Xactly, xactlycorp.com, and see how their AI-powered platform can help optimize your commissions, motivate your team, and drive growth - be sure to mention The Advanced Selling Podcast!

item.title: #789: Unlocking Your Inner Accountability
item.itunes:title: #789: Unlocking Your Inner Accountability
item.description:
In this thought-provoking episode, Bryan and Bill explore the concept of accountability in sales. They challenge the traditional notion of leaders holding sales teams accountable, arguing that true accountability stems from within.

Through insightful discussions and real-life examples, they provide a practical framework for salespeople to assess their strengths, identify areas for improvement, and find joy in the process.

Discover how embracing self-accountability can unlock greater motivation, discipline, and ultimately, better sales results. Whether you're a salesperson seeking personal growth or a leader looking to foster a culture of ownership, this episode offers valuable insights to help you reinvent your approach to accountability.

Struggling to design a sales compensation plan that actually works? Check out Xactly, xactlycorp.com, and see how their AI-powered platform can help optimize your commissions, motivate your team, and drive growth - be sure to mention The Advanced Selling Podcast!

item.title: #788: Removing the Guesswork from Sales
item.itunes:title: #788: Removing the Guesswork from Sales
item.description:
Accurate sales forecasting is a consistent struggle for many organizations. In this episode, Bill and Bryan dive deep into the root causes behind this prevalent issue.

They explore how leadership's pressure for inflated pipelines can lead to inaccurate forecasts, as well as the inherent unpredictability of human nature that impacts both buyers and sellers.

The guys discuss the importance of extreme objectivity in the sales process, addressing lagging closed dates and the need for a true partnership mindset between buyers and sellers. 

Struggling to design a sales compensation plan that actually works? Check out Xactly, xactlycorp.com, and see how their AI-powered platform can help optimize your commissions, motivate your team, and drive growth - be sure to mention The Advanced Selling Podcast!

item.itunes:title: #787: Motivating Beyond Money
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss best practices for motivating sales teams through compensation.

The guys explain why overly complex commission structures often backfire by eroding trust between sales reps and management. They share real world examples of commission plans gone wrong, and advise simplifying compensation to focus on customer needs instead of maximizing rep pay.

item.content:encoded:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss best practices for motivating sales teams through compensation.

The guys explain why overly complex commission structures often backfire by eroding trust between sales reps and management. They share real world examples of commission plans gone wrong, and advise simplifying compensation to focus on customer needs instead of maximizing rep pay.

They also emphasize striking a balance between company goals and rep motivations. Listen for tips on creating commission plans that incentivize integrity and service.

Struggling to design a sales compensation plan that actually works? Check out Xactly, xactlycorp.com, and see how their AI-powered platform can help optimize your commissions, motivate your team, and drive growth - be sure to mention The Advanced Selling Podcast!

item.title: #786: Thinking Outside the Sales Box
item.itunes:title: #786: Thinking Outside the Sales Box
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss some of their unconventional and counterintuitive sales tactics that go against the grain of traditional sales training.

They talk about focusing on quality over quantity in your sales pipeline, how more income doesn't necessarily require more work, keeping your intentions pure when prospecting, and how transforming your mindset is key to boosting your sales and income.

Tune in for a fresh perspective on selling that challenges sales coaching orthodoxy.

In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss the importance of taking inventory and making any necessary course corrections at this stage. Learn tips on capitalizing on a strong start or regaining momentum from a slower beginning.

They'll also cover the power of consistent behaviors and starting small to build sustainable growth.

Whether you're firing on all cylinders or need a spark, this timely mid-quarter checkup will get you focused on finishing 2024 strong.

item.title: #784: Inner Reflection for Outer Connection
item.itunes:title: #784: Inner Reflection for Outer Connection
item.description:
In this introspective episode, Bill and Bryan discuss the importance of being aligned with your true self in order to build rapport with others. They talk about examining your own limitations, beliefs, and patterns of self-sabotage that may be holding you back from living your purpose.

Bill shares how it's difficult to love others if you don't love yourself first. Bryan stresses the importance of telling yourself the truth and not beating yourself up.

The guys also recommend the book "Love Yourself Like Your Life Depends On It" by Kamal Ravikant for anyone struggling with low self-worth.

Tune in for an insightful discussion on getting in touch with your authentic self in order to improve relationships and success.

=================================

item.title: #783: Building Trust and Rapport in the Digital Age
item.itunes:title: #783: Building Trust and Rapport in the Digital Age
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss how to build genuine rapport and trust with prospects in a digital selling world.

They talk about why rapport starts from within and how to have an authentic intention to understand clients. They also share tips on using tools like Zoom more effectively and ways to create rapport digitally.

They guys explore what real trust means, how it's granted, not earned, and why trying too hard to "build rapport" can backfire. They emphasize being sincerely interested in learning about clients as individuals to foster genuine connections.

=================================

item.title: #782: The Courage to Speak Your Truth
item.itunes:title: #782: The Courage to Speak Your Truth
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan have an honest discussion about finding the courage to speak your truth in business and sales situations. They talk about times when we hold back from saying what we really think or feel, and why it's important to push past the fear and share truthful feedback and opinions even when it feels uncomfortable or risky.

The guys share stories and examples from their own careers about difficult conversations with clients and colleagues where they ultimately decided to speak up.

They explore the personal growth that can come from expressing your authentic perspective, and the positive impact it can have on relationships and outcomes when done with care and good intent. 

=================================

item.title: #781: The Art of the First Call
item.itunes:title: #781: The Art of the First Call
item.description:
In this episode, hosts Bill and Bryan share their best tips and strategies for nailing your first sales call. They discuss how to prepare mentally, set the right context, use an agenda, tell relevant stories, and research your prospect.

The guys emphasize having the right mindset of curiosity and fun rather than pressuring for the sale. They give actionable advice for building rapport quickly and exploring whether there should even be a second call.

Tune in to pick up tactics that will transform your cold calls into warm, engaging conversations.

=================================

item.title: #780: Quick Hacks to Level Up Your LinkedIn Videos
item.itunes:title: #780: Quick Hacks to Level Up Your LinkedIn Videos
item.description:
In this quick episode, Bill and Bryan provide some tactical tips to help you get started creating high-quality LinkedIn video content in 2024.

The guys discuss how to frame your video around solving a specific problem, finding leverage like hiring an intern to help edit and repurpose your videos, being consistent with your process and format, and offering a clear call-to-action.

Whether you're new to LinkedIn video or want to step up your game in the new year, this episode will help set you on the path to success.

item.title: #779: Can One Word Boost Your Sales in Q1?
item.itunes:title: #779: Can One Word Boost Your Sales in Q1?
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss the power of choosing a single word to focus on each quarter of the year.

The guys explain how picking an intentional word like "process" or "leverage" can help salespeople stay focused, make better decisions, and achieve their goals. 

They give you their strategies for selecting meaningful words of the quarter and putting them into practice in both business and life. They also share real examples of using these words to filter choices and actions.

item.title: #778: If You Had $1,000 to Invest, Where Would You Put It?
item.itunes:title: #778: If You Had $1,000 to Invest, Where Would You Put It?
item.description:
In this Holiday episode of The Advanced Selling Podcast, Bill and Bryan discuss an interesting question - if you had $1,000 to invest in your business or career in 2023 with the goal of generating more revenue in 2024, what would you spend it on?

The guys share ideas like investing in LinkedIn Premium, sales enablement software, creating opt-in lead generation assets, and hosting events to position yourself as a thought leader.

Tune in for their recommendations on how to leverage a small investment into bigger sales success.

item.title: #777: Expanding Beyond Your Comfort Zone
item.itunes:title: #777: Expanding Beyond Your Comfort Zone
item.description:
As 2023 draws to a close, Bill and Bryan reflect on key lessons and changes from this year that they aim to carry with them into 2024. This includes maintaining a steadfast mindset that "everything will be okay" even amidst challenges, focusing more on purpose over profits, and perfecting their sales processes for optimal results.

Looking ahead, they preview a future episode where they will explore the self-image dilemma - how our subconscious beliefs about ourselves can inadvertently limit our ability to reach our full potential, even when presented with clear opportunities for growth.

The guys plan to take a deeper dive into understanding and overcoming this self-sabotaging phenomenon.

=================================

item.title: #776: A Rockstar Game Plan to Start the New Year Strong
item.itunes:title: #776: A Rockstar Game Plan to Start the New Year Strong
item.description:
As 2023 winds down, Bill and Bryan share practical advice for sales professionals to hit the ground running on January 2nd.

The guys discuss the power of planning ahead, calendaring key activities, and using the holidays to create assets like webinars. Even if your plans feel like a pipe dream now, put them on the calendar and work backwards.

Gain momentum going into the new year so you're fired up, focused, and ready to crush it!

Is it time for you to get serious about your 2024 goals? If so, join our 2024 Personal Business Planning Masterclass on December 6th. To learn more go to http://billcaskey.com/personalbusinessplanning

item.title: #775: Marketing in the Age of Authenticity
item.itunes:title: #775: Marketing in the Age of Authenticity
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan explore how the tide is turning against inauthentic marketing outreach. With major email providers restricting spam, sales professionals now need marketing plans centered around value and relevance.

How can you leverage existing social media habits to be more active on LinkedIn? What marketing behaviors should you commit to consistently?

Tune in as Bill and Bryan discuss why sales and marketing success in 2024 will require embracing personalization and eschewing mass outreach spray and pray approaches of the past. Learn how to craft marketing that cuts through the noise by leading with authenticity.

Is it time for you to get serious about your 2024 goals? If so, join our 2024 Personal Business Planning Masterclass on December 6th. To learn more go to http://billcaskey.com/personalbusinessplanning

item.title: #774: Identifying Your Unique Gifts and Talents
item.itunes:title: #774: Identifying Your Unique Gifts and Talents
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss the importance of identifying and utilizing your unique gifts and talents in business and sales. They talk about how natural talents can often be overlooked because they come so easily to us.

The guys provide examples of skills that are in their "zone of genius" versus skills that are a struggle. They emphasize leveraging your gifts and spending less time trying to improve weaknesses.

Whether you believe your gifts come from a higher power or are developed over time, they encourage you to reflect on and better utilize your unique abilities.

Is it time for you to get serious about your 2024 goals? If so, join our 2024 Personal Business Planning Masterclass on December 6th. To learn more go to http://billcaskey.com/personalbusinessplanning

item.title: #773: Avoiding Common Year-End Sales Mistakes
item.itunes:title: #773: Avoiding Common Year-End Sales Mistakes
item.description:
Bill and Bryan discuss some of the most common mistakes sales teams make when trying to close out the year strong. They talk about the dangers of discounting to hit quota, warning that this can train customers to always expect a deal. 

The guys emphasize starting with the intention to help prospects truly, not just make the numbers look good. They advise against putting too much pressure on prospects to close deals by year-end when there may not be a good reason and the importance of having a vision for both the next 30-45 days and the coming year so you don't lose momentum. 

Time for you to get serious about your 2024 goals? If so join our 2024 Personal Business Planning Masterclass on December 6th. To learn more go to http://billcaskey.com/personalbusinessplanning

item.itunes:title: System of Action vs. System of Record
item.description:
This week we’re bringing you a bonus episode of ASP! Host Bryan Neale sat down with Bill Johnson, CEO of Salesvue.

The two discuss the stark difference between sales when they started their career and sales in 2023. They also dig into how to make your CRM your system of action vs. just your system of record.

To learn more about Salesvue and whether it can help grow your business, visit https://salesvue.com.

item.title: #772: Evaluating What Truly Matters
item.itunes:title: #772: Evaluating What Truly Matters
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan have an important conversation about fulfillment and meaning beyond just hitting sales targets and revenue goals. They introduce the concept of the Thriving and Fulfillment Inventory (TFI), encouraging listeners to take stock of what activities and parts of their work truly light them up versus simply going through the motions.

The guys share personal examples from their own careers about times they've chased validation or followed a certain path just because it led to more money, but didn't actually bring joy or meaning. They also stress the importance of having supportive people in your life who will encourage you to pursue your passions. Even if it doesn't immediately make sense on paper, sometimes it's those less obvious ideas that end up thriving and leading to fulfillment. 

=================================

item.title: #771: The Invisible Forces Holding Your Back
item.itunes:title: #771: The Invisible Forces Holding Your Back
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss the invisible forces that hold us back from reaching our full potential. They talk about how we can get comfortable with a certain level of achievement or income, and then stop pushing ourselves to grow once we reach that threshold.

The guys explore the roots of this "invisible pole" that anchors many of us from ascending to the next level in our careers and lives. They share motivating stories of public figures who have walked away from fame and fortune in pursuit of a simpler, more meaningful life.

They also delve into the power of choice - how we can consciously choose our path and change course at any time. If you struggle with an invisible force holding you back, this episode will give you perspective and tools to break free.

=================================

item.title: #770: Finding Passion, Purpose and Performance in Sales
item.itunes:title: #770: Finding Passion, Purpose and Performance in Sales
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan tackle the common pressure for salespeople to make their passion their job and income source. They offer perspective around looking deeper to find fulfillment in elements of your current sales role, while also pursuing side projects and passions outside of work that can boost energy, creativity and performance.

Drawing from their own experiences, they share stories and tips to help salespeople and other professionals nurture their interests and find deeper purpose, both within and outside of their primary career. 

Tune in for an engaging dialogue and practical wisdom around achieving fulfillment both in and out of your sales job. Discover ways to love what you do, while also making time for the things you love.

=================================

item.title: #769: Leveraging Your Assets to Achieve More
item.itunes:title: #769: Leveraging Your Assets to Achieve More
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss how high achievers and experienced sales professionals can get to the next level, not by necessarily learning new skills, but by better leveraging the skills and assets they already have.

The guys talk about how our mindset of "more work and effort" often holds us back from identifying and utilizing key leverage points like time, relationships, talent, and technology. They also share examples and perspectives on how to inventory your unique assets and think creatively about maximizing them to improve your income, impact, and fulfillment in selling.

=================================

item.title: #768: Death By Data: When Numbers Kill the Sales Mojo
item.itunes:title: #768: Death By Data: When Numbers Kill the Sales Mojo
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan debate the pros and cons of relying too heavily on data in sales. They discuss common sales metrics like funnel velocity, win rates, and lead response times.

While data can provide useful insights, the guys argue overusing statistics can drain the human creativity, relationships, and instinct needed to close deals.

They'll help give you some perspectives on keeping data in its place so it doesn't kill the sales mojo. They also tell you how to leverage numbers to complement rather than replace sales skills and emotional intelligence.

=================================

item.itunes:title: #767: Maximizing Potential in Sales
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss the critical role of sales leadership in helping teams reach their full potential.

The guys highlight the need for sales leaders to lead by example and invest in their own growth. The hosts also emphasize the importance of self-improvement for sales professionals and how taking ownership of your development can lead to breakthroughs in your career.

If you're looking for insights on sales leadership, personal growth, and maximizing your potential in sales, tune in for valuable tips and inspiration.

item.title: #766: Is It Time to Make a Career Transition?
item.itunes:title: #766: Is It Time to Make a Career Transition?
item.description:
Are you in the job market or planning to make a move soon?

In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss tips for job seekers in the current market and share strategies for finishing the year strong in sales.

The guys offer valuable advice on standing out and positioning yourself effectively to land your dream sales job. They also emphasize the importance of being visible and leveraging your personal brand through platforms like LinkedIn.

As we celebrate our 17 years of podcasting, we want to hear from you! Send us your well-wishes, questions, or any thoughts you'd like to share. Email us at listener@advancedsellingpodcast.com. We appreciate your support and look forward to the next 17 years with you!

item.title: #765: Old School Techniques That Still Work
item.itunes:title: #765: Old School Techniques That Still Work
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan continue their birthday celebration by revisiting some old school sales techniques that still pack a punch in the modern world of selling.

The guys share insights on picking up the phone for personal outreach, getting in the game by attending events and networking, asking for help, and the power of inviting prospects to meaningful events.

These timeless strategies are a reminder that successful sales is about building genuine connections and leveraging them for business growth. Don't miss this episode filled with practical tips that can reinvigorate your sales efforts.

This episode is not just a celebration of their podcast but a glimpse into the power of consistency, camaraderie, and the global reach of podcasting.

item.title: #761: To Cadence or Not to Cadence
item.itunes:title: #761: To Cadence or Not to Cadence
item.description:
In this episode, hosts Bill Caskey and Bryan Neale tackle the age-old question of sales cadences – the structured outreach sequences used by many salespeople.

They discuss the merits of using a cadence while emphasizing the need for authenticity and value delivery. Bill and Bryan share insights into crafting meaningful interactions, rather than relying on automated templates.

They challenge the idea of a one-size-fits-all approach, suggesting that offering valuable tools and advice can be more effective in building relationships.

Tune in to gain a fresh perspective on sales cadences and discover how to strike the right balance between science and authenticity in your sales efforts.

item.title: #760: Navigating the Journey from Unseen to Desired
item.itunes:title: #760: Navigating the Journey from Unseen to Desired
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan dive into a candid conversation about a common frustration they share when coaching clients – the challenge of convincing clients to create valuable content that bridges the gap between being unknown and becoming a trusted partner in the eyes of their prospects.

The guys explore the journey from initial unawareness to eventual engagement and how offering a "gesture of value" at the start of this journey can be a game-changer for clients. They share insights on overcoming resistance, letting go of attachment to outcomes, and embracing the 80/20 principle to identify and nurture clients who are truly aligned with growth.

=================================

item.title: #759: Mastering the Fundamentals of Sales
item.itunes:title: #759: Mastering the Fundamentals of Sales
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan return to the bedrock of successful sales: Prospecting and Active Listening. The guys reflect on the enduring power of these two fundamental skills.

Bill shares a pivotal lesson from his past, shifting his prospecting mindset from self-gain to problem-solving for clients. Bryan highlights the art of active listening with genuine intention, building deeper connections.

They draw insights from Steve Jobs' storytelling and Apple's timeless strategies, reminding us that core principles never fade. Discover how these ageless techniques can redefine your sales approach.

item.title: #758: Boosting Your Income in Sales
item.itunes:title: #758: Boosting Your Income in Sales
item.description:
Are you ready to shatter the limits on your income potential? In this episode, Bill and Bryan explore the secrets of achieving exponential income growth in sales and leadership roles.

Drawing from their Insider program's insights, the guys demystify the concept of "exponential income," going beyond linear percentages. They challenge you to ask the right questions about your income goals, encouraging you to envision a world where extraordinary earnings are possible.

By adopting a mindset of attracting abundance and opportunities, rather than constantly chasing money, you'll unleash your earning potential and pave the way for unparalleled growth.

item.itunes:title: #755: What's Really Going On?
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan delve into the hidden factors that often hinder sales professionals from taking necessary actions. They shed light on the blind spots that can cloud judgment and impede success.

By asking the crucial question, "What's really going on?", Bill and Bryan encourage listeners to explore the underlying fears and mindset obstacles that prevent them from reaching their full potential. They also discuss how reframing problems and embracing a contrarian perspective can lead to breakthroughs in both personal and professional growth.

Tune in to uncover the truth and unlock your sales potential.

item.title: #754: Removing Friction From the Sales Process
item.itunes:title: #754: Removing Friction From the Sales Process
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss the idea of removing friction in the sales process.

Drawing inspiration from a conversation with movement specialist Dr. Kelly Sterrett, they explore the importance of setting up processes that are easy to adhere to. While discussing the parallels between fitness and sales, they highlight the challenges faced in executing the sales process and provide insights on how to overcome them.

They examine various barriers that hinder the smooth execution of the sales process, such as discomfort, fear, attachment to outcomes, and lack of clarity regarding the problems they solve for clients.

Additionally, they address the resistance to ending a sales process that has lingered without progress. Tune in to this episode for an engaging discussion on identifying and eliminating friction points in the sales process, ultimately paving the way for more effective and successful selling.

=================================

item.title: #751: Avoid Deal-Ending Surprises By Preempting Them
item.itunes:title: #751: Avoid Deal-Ending Surprises By Preempting Them
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan dive into a common sales challenge: dealing with unexpected surprises in the sales process.

They discuss a recent situation faced by one of Bill's clients, where a seemingly promising deal suddenly took a sharp turn in another direction. Bill seeks Bryan's feedback on how to handle such situations and explores the concept of preemption to prevent future shell shocks.

Listen in to learn the importance of resilience, perspective, and the power of detachment in navigating sales surprises.

item.content:encoded:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan dive into a common sales challenge: dealing with unexpected surprises in the sales process.

They discuss a recent situation faced by one of Bill's clients, where a seemingly promising deal suddenly took a sharp turn in another direction. Bill seeks Bryan's feedback on how to handle such situations and explores the concept of preemption to prevent future shell shocks.

Listen in to learn the importance of resilience, perspective, and the power of detachment in navigating sales surprises.

item.title: #750: Creating a Stellar Customer Experience
item.itunes:title: #750: Creating a Stellar Customer Experience
item.description:
In this episode of The Advanced Selling Podcast, Bill and Bryan dive into the importance of customer experience beyond the sales process.

Bryan shares a nerve-wracking car buying experience, highlighting the significance of every touchpoint a customer encounters. From the initial sales interaction to the onboarding process and beyond, the guys discuss the impact of consistent and thoughtful customer experience.

Tune in to discover how exceptional customer experiences can lead to increased referrals and long-term customer loyalty.

item.title: #749: Embracing a Sales Philosophy for Transformation
item.itunes:title: #749: Embracing a Sales Philosophy for Transformation
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss the challenge of getting individuals who are only dabbling in new information to fully commit and embrace a new way of thinking.

They explore the root causes of resistance to change and going all in, highlighting fear and comfort as major factors. They also share some ways to take a rigorously honest look at one's sales approach and suggest codifying a sales philosophy as a starting point for change.

Discover how going all in on a sales philosophy can lead to profound transformation and success in the world of sales.

item.title: #748: Engaging the C-Suite
item.itunes:title: #748: Engaging the C-Suite
item.description:
In this episode, Bill Caskey and Bryan Neale of The Advanced Selling Podcast delve into the importance of engaging top-level executives, particularly CEOs, in the sales process. 

They discuss how involving CEOs can significantly increase closing rates and share their insights on why this is beneficial for both the salesperson and the customer. 

Listeners will gain valuable strategies for engaging the C-suite and improving their overall sales success.

item.title: #747: Avoiding Burnout in Sales
item.itunes:title: #747: Avoiding Burnout in Sales
item.description:
In this episode, sales experts Bill Caskey and Bryan Neale discuss the concept of burnout and the impact it can have on salespeople in today's environment.

They address the self-imposed and other factors contributing to burnout and explore strategies for avoiding burnout and maintaining mental and emotional health. And emphasize the importance of managing personal well-being while continuing to grow and build in the sales industry.

The guys also touch on the concept of reorienting and reinventing one's sales process to achieve desired outcomes without compromising personal health and well-being. Tune in to gain valuable insights on how to avoid burnout and sustain a healthy and successful sales career.

item.title: #744: Shifting Your Ideal Client
item.itunes:title: #744: Shifting Your Ideal Client
item.description:
In this episode of the Advanced Selling Podcast, Bill and Bryan discuss the trend of sales resistance in certain markets and the need to retool the ideal client. 

The guys address the fear of change that often comes with deciding to pivot even slightly and offer strategies to overcome it. They also talk about the importance of getting back to the problem and solution alignment, exploring new departments or markets, and facilitating the retooling process with the sales team, marketing, and product.

Tune in to learn how to shift your ideal client and overcome sales resistance to drive sales success.

In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss this old debate that keeps coming up and give their opinions on hunters vs. farmers. They also give some tips to the sales leaders out there who feel like they don't have enough of either of these traits in their sales team.

item.title: #741: Sales vs. Marketing
item.itunes:title: #741: Sales vs. Marketing
item.description:
Is your marketing department working with you or against you? 

In this episode, Bryan and Bill talk about a problem they see in many companies: sales and marketing not working together. They discuss how the two speak different languages, but they don't have to be at odds. 

And they'll give you some ways to better work with your marketing team. 

If you have a marketing department, be sure to forward this episode to them!

item.title: #740: Resistance to Change
item.itunes:title: #740: Resistance to Change
item.description:
When the guys start working with a new client, they often see the same thing. Some of the people are completely open to coaching, but some are very resistant to new ideas or change.

Where does this resistance come from, and is it hurting or helping us?

In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss reticence and resistance and how they might hold us back. They also give you ways to overcome this resistance to help you succeed.

item.itunes:title: #739: People Buy From People They...
item.description:

item.title: #738: Old School vs. New School Selling
item.itunes:title: #738: Old School vs. New School Selling
item.description:
Are you still using outdated sales strategies? Today, you might just find out. 

In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss old-school selling techniques that no longer work and their new school alternatives. 

They'll also give you some ideas that you can use to modernize your sales process. 

—Copy and paste this in and send it to people who do bad outreach :)—
Thanks for your outreach. Not interested at this time, but may I offer some unsolicited advice?

This is a guide for outreach that we use for our sales team. The templates are unique and seem to get action. It's called "EmailIt: A Seller's Guide" ($20).

https://resources.billcaskey.com/emailitsellersguide

The author is Bill Caskey. He also has a podcast specifically for B2B sales teams he does with Bryan Neale, called The Advanced Selling Podcast.

You can find it here:
www.advancedsellingpodcast.com

I hope these ideas are of some value.
item.content:encoded:
Are you still using outdated sales strategies? Today, you might just find out. 

In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss old-school selling techniques that no longer work and their new school alternatives. 

They'll also give you some ideas that you can use to modernize your sales process. 

—Copy and paste this in and send it to people who do bad outreach :)—Thanks for your outreach. Not interested at this time, but may I offer some unsolicited advice? This is a guide for outreach that we use for our sales team. The templates are unique and seem to get action. It's called "EmailIt: A Seller's Guide" ($20). https://resources.billcaskey.com/emailitsellersguide The author is Bill Caskey. He also has a podcast specifically for B2B sales teams he does with Bryan Neale, called The Advanced Selling Podcast. You can find it here:www.advancedsellingpodcast.com I hope these ideas are of some value.

They also give you some ways to avoid underperforming yourself as well.

item.title: #720: Are Big Deals Unique?
item.itunes:title: #720: Are Big Deals Unique?
item.description:
Do you suffer from "Bigdealitis?" Where you get really attached to a big deal, and your normal sales process goes out the window.

In this episode, Bill and Bryan break down some of the elements of a large-size deal, and they discuss how it might be different from a normal deal. They'll give you some ways you can keep focused if a big deal comes along and maybe just cure your "Bigdealitis" :) 

=================================

The Insider program is open for enrollment. If you have not checked out our version of a small learning group go to http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/insider to join today!

item.title: #719: The Importance of Inspection
item.itunes:title: #719: The Importance of Inspection
item.description:
Are you inspecting your deals after they are done? 

We get it, your first instinct when you hear this topic is probably, No, thank you! 

But, in this episode, the guys give you the reasons why you should be inspecting your deals at a deep level. You might just find the areas that are most underdeveloped and, in turn, close more deals.

item.title: #717: Are Your Expectations Realistic?
item.itunes:title: #717: Are Your Expectations Realistic?
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss where your expectations fit in your current situation. 

When things are going great, it's easy to set your expectations extremely high. But what about when things aren't going so well? That's when expectations can become unrealistic. 

The guys give you some ways you can get your expectations back in check.

=================================

item.title: #716: What Does Your Sales Culture Look Like?
item.itunes:title: #716: What Does Your Sales Culture Look Like?
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss Sales Culture. They share some of the better cultures that they've experienced as well as some bad ones they've seen.

They'll challenge you to ask the question, "how am I contributing to our team's culture?" If you're not contributing in a positive way, how can you change that?

They'll also give you some ways you can improve your culture and in turn your results. 

=================================

item.title: #714: Finding Your Inspiration
item.itunes:title: #714: Finding Your Inspiration
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan revisit the poll that they discussed in the last episode. They decide to take the third response and devote an entire episode, all about inspiration. 

Over the last couple of years with the pandemic and the impending recession, it can easy to lack inspiration. 

The guys give you some ways you can look at your life in a different way and draw the inspiration you need to stay focused. 

They'll be running more polls in the LI group soon so if you're not part of it, join now! http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/linkedin

item.title: #712: Are We In a Recession?
item.itunes:title: #712: Are We In a Recession?
item.description:
In this episode of The Advanced Selling Podcast, Bill and Bryan discuss whether they think we are on the verge of a recession and what it could mean for your business. 

Most businesses have been in steady growth mode for over a decade now but things might not be looking so great in the next year or so. 

The guys talk through how to handle the impact and Bill even challenges you to think about what part of your business could actually benefit from being in a recession.

=================================

item.title: #708: Your Discipline Action Plan
item.itunes:title: #708: Your Discipline Action Plan
item.description:
In this episode of The Advanced Selling Podcast, Bill and Bryan finish their 2 part series all about discipline. 

In part 1 the guys discuss how to evaluate your discipline level in all areas of your life. The idea here is to find the gaps where you might be lacking the necessary discipline to help you succeed. 

In part 2 the guys give you a method of developing an action plan to fill in those gaps and work on building the discipline you need.

If you haven't already listened to part 1, be sure to go back and take a listen!

In this episode of The Advanced Selling Podcast, Bill and Bryan start a 2 part series all about discipline. 

In part 1 the guys discuss how to evaluate your discipline level in all areas of your life. The idea here is to find the gaps where you might be lacking the necessary discipline to help you succeed. 

In part 2 the guys will give you a method of developing a plan to fill in those gaps and work on building the discipline you need. Be sure to listen in next week!

=================================

item.title: #706: Is Your Sales Coaching All Wrong?
item.itunes:title: #706: Is Your Sales Coaching All Wrong?
item.description:
Recently, Bill was in a coaching session with another sales trainer, and he was astounded by what he heard. The coach was teaching the group how to persuade the customer to do business with you and ways to manipulate them into getting your way.

These techniques haven't changed since the 60s and '70s. 

In this episode, Bill and Bryan discuss what's wrong with these techniques and how you can create a modern sales process that doesn't contain any sleazy gimmicks. 

=================================

item.itunes:title: #705: Are You Sales Ready?
item.description:
Let's face it, for the last 10 years or more, we've been in somewhat of a tailwind. All things have been easier than ever to sell. 

But, things might not be so easy in the coming months or years. 

In this episode, Bill and Bryan help you to take inventory of your current skills and challenge you to evaluate what skills you'll need to become truly Sales Ready for any market!

item.title: #704: How to Construct a Compelling Offer
item.itunes:title: #704: How to Construct a Compelling Offer
item.description:
Usually “offers” which we define as everything that you will deliver to your customer, are prepared by the marketing department.

But we also have seen marketing departments being lax in this area. So you may have to deconstruct or reconstruct the offer so that it speaks to your customer.

In this episode, we give you 5 elements of a great offer that you can use starting immediately so that when you communicate that offer to your prospects and customers, they are clear about how you will solve their problems or get them to their land of opportunity.

=================================

If you haven't already, make sure you join us in our LinkedIn group: www.advancedsellingpodcast.com/linkedin.

item.title: #703: Getting Your Pivot Point Right
item.itunes:title: #703: Getting Your Pivot Point Right
item.description:
With any sales process, there is a pivot point that happens where you stop talking about their issues, pains, and problems and begin talking about how you can bring value to their circumstance.

That is what we call the “pivot point.”

In this episode, Bill and Bryan give you some ideas on making this pivot seamless so that it’s not clunky and awkward.

This is part one of a two-part series on how to make your offer and talk about it. Next week we will address Offer Construction.

=================================

item.title: #699: Closing the Sales Execution Gap with Scott Barker
item.itunes:title: #699: Closing the Sales Execution Gap with Scott Barker
item.description:
Every revenue team suffers a Sales Execution Gap — the ever-growing gap between an organization’s potential revenue and the actual revenue it achieves.

As the Sales Execution Gap expands, organizations miss more deals, waste more time, and lose more reps.

How did we get here? How do we prevent the Sales Execution Gap? And, how do we close the Gap to execute at our full potential?

In this episode, Scott Barker gives us some ways you can close the gap and solve this ever-growing issue in your business. 

To learn more about how Scott and the Outreach team can help, go to http://outreach.io

item.title: #698: “Awareness” Might Be a Key to Sales Growth
item.itunes:title: #698: “Awareness” Might Be a Key to Sales Growth
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan address the etheric notion of awareness in the sales process.

When we are unaware of what is happening to us, we will respond in error. They discuss "awareness" from the aspect of “how to interact with prospects” and also, “how we interact with ourselves.”

Be sure to save your spot for this week's LIVE RECORDING on May 4 “The Sales Execution Gap” with Scott Barker from Outreach! Go to http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/outreach to register now.

item.title: #695: How to Effectively Manage Deals in the Pipeline
item.itunes:title: #695: How to Effectively Manage Deals in the Pipeline
item.description:
In this episode Bill and Bryan address “deal management”, which is another word for how to control and lead the sales process.

They also give you some thoughts on how to best build momentum at the start of the process.

It is one of the three biggest challenges we find companies have in executing to achieve great sales results.

This month’s episodes are part of a lead-up to a LIVE RECORDING on May 4 “The Sales Execution Gap” with Scott Barker from Outreach! Go to http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/outreach to register now.

If you are a sales producer, manager, VP of sales, or CEO, you should consider attending this complimentary one-hour live session.

How do you communicate your value at the beginning so the prospect can decide whether or not you are a good fit?

item.title: #685: Are We Really This Bad at Emails?
item.itunes:title: #685: Are We Really This Bad at Emails?
item.description:
In this episode, Bill and Bryan review a message thread where a salesperson is pitching one of our listeners. He forwarded us the message as an example of what not to do and the guys dissect it.

If you have an email that is a train wreck that has come from someone wanting to do business with you, forward it on to listener@advancedsellingpodcast.com.

We will dissect it on the air. Don't worry, completely anonymous. We won't use your name nor the sender‘s. Let’s see if we can fix this epidemic of terrible emails!

=================================

item.title: #684: What to Say When You Can't Ship
item.description:
We’ve gotten a lot of questions recently given the supply chain disruptions. It truly is a difficult issue right now. Most of the time we hear, "how do I handle customers who have open orders but I can’t deliver the goods?"

In this podcast episode, Bill and Bryan give you some thoughts on how to handle this very difficult dilemma that you might find yourself in.

item.description:
In this episode, the guys get into the deep work of assessing your limiting beliefs. Where are your limiting beliefs holding you back from your success?

This comes from the work that Bill and Bryan do with individual performers and corporate clients. It’s where half the group moves to higher levels of success but the rest of the group does not.

It’s always a belief issue.

item.title: The Best Sales Advice I Ever Received with Keenan
item.description:
Continuing the series, "The Best Sales Advice," Bill and Bryan invited master sales disruptor, Keenan https://www.asalesguy.com, to join them in this episode. 

Keenan is the author of the best-selling book, Gap Selling, and the CEO and president of A Sales Guy, Inc. For the past ten years, he’s ranked in the Top 50 Most Influential Salespeople by Top Sales World magazine.

The guys have been following him for years. And, after hearing this episode, you will, too!

item.title: #677: The 11th Hour Quagmire, How to Prevent It
item.description:
We’ve all had this happen to us; we’re in the 11th hour, we’ve delivered a proposal, and the prospect tells us to hang tight and wait.

This question came in from our LinkedIn group, Daniel, who has had this happen several times. Listen to this episode if you want clear concise prevention strategies so this doesn’t happen to you again.

=========================================

The Insider program is open for enrollment. If you have not checked out our version of a small learning group go to http://advancedsellingpodcast.com/insider to join today!

Do you have a question you want to be answered on the podcast? Email us at listener@advancedsellingpodcast.com and we'll try to answer it on an upcoming episode!

Looking for more sales training like this podcast? Download our FREE audio program, The Ultimate Pre-Game. http://ultimatepregame.com

=========================================
item.content:encoded:
We’ve all had this happen to us; we’re in the 11th hour, we’ve delivered a proposal, and the prospect tells us to hang tight and wait.

This question came in from our LinkedIn group, Daniel, who has had this happen several times. Listen to this episode if you want clear concise prevention strategies so this doesn’t happen to you again.

item.title: #676: Is Sales Broken?
item.description:
Is sales really broken? In many ways it is. 

This episode was inspired by an email Bill received from Anthony Iannarino discussing why sales is broken. Anthony lists the stats that he's uncovered from both the seller and the buyer that backs up his belief.

In this episode, Bill and Bryan start to break down the areas where they think sales is broken and they give you some ways you can reframe your thinking to accommodate the new ways of selling.

item.title: The Best Sales Advice I Ever Received with Mark Hunter
item.description:
In this exclusive series called "The Best Sales Advice I Ever Received," Bill and Bryan are handpicking some of the industry's top leaders to have them share the best advice that they've gotten in their careers. 

Sales legend, author, and speaker Mark Hunter joins Bill and Bryan in the studio this week with some simple yet profound advice: stay focused, stay consistent. These two foundational principles touch on every aspect of the sales process from your motivation level to your customer interactions to your learning. Tune in to this inspiring episode with the master “hunter” and guru of high-profit prospecting.

To learn more about Mark, go to  https://thesaleshunter.com.

item.title: #674: How important is the customer experience when it comes to sales? with Kris Rudeegraap, Sendoso
item.description:
A business is made or slayed along the customer journey.

Think US Airways. Blockbuster. 

When businesses fail, it’s usually due to a lack of empathy with their customers. Automated phone service, long wait times, Draconian return policies. The list goes on and on.

The competitive advantage goes to companies who get it right. 

Think Apple. Wayfair. Trader Joe’s. 

You have to map out the customer’s journey and manage every single touchpoint along the way.  For the salesperson, the customer experience doesn’t end when the deal is signed. The best salespeople keep coming around, maintaining that rapport over time.

In this episode of The Advanced Selling Podcast, Kris Rudeegraap, CEO and Co-founder of Sendoso, shares his tips on enhancing the customer journey through empathy, energy, and generosity.

He explains why account-based marketing (ABM) is like fishing with a spear instead of a fishing net. You won’t want to miss this one. 

AFTER YOU LISTEN: 

Check out the Sendoso platform and lunch is on the guys! https://sendoso.com/demo-request/

item.title: #673: Gifting. Sales gimmick or great move? with Kris Rudeegraap, Sendoso
item.description:
You’ve heard the old saying… 

“Giving is better than receiving because giving starts the receiving process.”

But does it work when it comes to sales prospecting?

Absolutely. 

Studies show the ROI on gifting a prospect is high – and gifting a current client usually ends up in a longer-term relationship, repeat business, and more referrals.  

So… if you want to make an impact, differentiate, be remembered, and build goodwill, consider gifting.  Spice up your prospecting efforts with creativity, thoughtfulness, and personalization.

The key is to give without expectation.

Whether it’s a welcome kit or free content – a podcast episode, a download, a handwritten note – it’s impossible to forget someone who’s gone out of their way to help. 

To learn more about the art of business gifting, check out the conversation with Kris Rudeegraap, CEO and Co-founder of Sendoso, the leading sending platform. 

AFTER YOU LISTEN: 

Check out the Sendoso platform and lunch is on the guys! https://sendoso.com/demo-request/

item.title: #672: Celebrating the small sales wins leads to the big ones with Kris Rudeegraap, Sendoso
item.description:
For lack of a better cliché…sales is a rollercoaster. Highs. Lows.
We’ve all been there. Building momentum is key.

We’re usually so concerned with reaching the next peak that we forget to recognize the smaller wins along the way. And the worse culprits are oftentimes our managers

This week, Kris Rudeegraap, CEO and CO-founder of Sendoso, the leading gifting platform, joins us to talk about putting the wind back in your sales, driving the momentum through the ups
and downs – and why the proverbial pat on the back is critical.

After you listen: 
Check out the Sendoso platform and lunch is on the guys! 
https://sendoso.com/demo-request/

item.title: #671: How can you stand out? with Kris Rudeegraap
item.description:
We are not in the new normal - it's the next normal. Bill and Bryan believe that in this next normal, you have to humanize your brand. 

Kris Rudeegraap, CEO of Sendoso, joins the show for a special four-part series exploring innovative ideas to help you stand out. In this first episode, he shares how he went from SDR to tech founder, raising a $100 million Series C fund while highlighting one key tactic for creating differentiation. 

After you listen: 

BE SURE to register for a special live event focusing on trust  How to build it, nurture it, and sustain it.

Sendoso’s CONNECTED Conference is October 13 from 11am to 3pm (EST). And as an Advanced Selling podcast listener lunch is on Sendoso if you CLICK HERE and reserve your spot now!

Join an all-star assembly of some of the best minds in marketing as they focus on TRUST, the key to better prospect and customer relationships, a better pipeline, and repeat business. It begins with credibility and ends when you stand out from the crowd. 

These 4 hours could change your business. 

Hosted by Trevor Noah, of The Daily Show, and Shola Richards, from Go Together Global.

item.title: Opinions vs Reality with Gong: Which CTAs book more meetings?
item.description:
After analyzing 300,000 cold emails, the team at Gong has debunked one of sales’ greatest mysteries — and unlocked a strategy to DOUBLE the amount of meetings you book.

We are joined once again by the Devin and Sheena from Reveal: The Revenue Integillance Podcast. And, as you know, sales usually is not binary, typically nuances play into every situation.

However, this is the exception. The CTA (call to action) you use at the end of your email, matters more than you think.

To craft the perfect cold email, tune in to the episode then follow this link, https://pages.gong.io/highly-effective-email-ctas to find 43 emails proven highly effective by Gong’s research team.

To listen to the Reality, subscribe to Reveal: The RI Podcast here: https://link.chtbl.com/i6UODNbY

item.description:
Should you use slides on a discovery call?

Choose wisely because it impacts your chances of booking the next meeting by 17%.

On this episode of Opinions vs. Reality, we are joined once again by Devin and Sheena from Reveal - the Revenue Intelligence Podcast. We give you our opinion on the impact of using slide decks.

And, for when it’s the right decision, check out this cheat sheet for crafting sales decks that sell: https://pages.gong.io/crafting-sales-decks-checklist

To listen to the Reality, subscribe to Reveal: The RI Podcast here: https://podcast.gong.io

item.description:
In this episode, Bill relays a story of one of his new clients who has asked for help on messaging. They sell a very complex solution to a large group of people in a long selling cycle.

He is struggling with how to craft his message so that it’s compelling to the prospect.

Bill and Bryan give you a handful of ideas on what to do and what not to do in this episode.
